author: nathansamson
title: Networking events
description: Awareness of Cardano's projects and vision are very low on the ground here among investors, young people and community leaders in Ethiopia.

assessments.note: This seems like a reasonable project to promote Cardano in Ethiopia. Perhaps rather than a monthly  event in one city it should move around the country or the continent.

Having networking events might be tricky. 

One thing is to organize such an event, the other is to create an interest in it. It can end up with empty meetings, that is why I took one star away. 

also, the budget vs outcome feels overextended.
Useful proposal in the heart of the target zone. Makes sense to promote Cardano in this community and therefore this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.

If we exclude the current situation with the pandemic, where larger group gatherings are not recommended/allowed (depending on each country's policies), this proposal could potentially help grow the Cardano community in Ethiopia and at the same time, help students and entrepreneurs discover the potential of the Cardano ecosystem and grow alongside it.

The proposal fits well with the objectives of the challenge, because it promises to promote face-to-face meetings in the capital of Ethiopia in order to discuss issues pertinent to the Catalyst project. The number of purely African participants would be considerable, most of the public and the organizers, and the idea fits well with the questions of novelty and adequacy, because in the city there is not a good circulation of information about the community and this new event would be very positive.

The awareness events can educate power centers regarding the possibilities of Cardano Blockchain on offer. The presence of people on the ground can have a much lasting influence than any information video on that basis this proposal can have significant impact.

The idea is very good. Since Ethiopia is a country where Cardano is probably going to have, at least proportionally, the greatest number of users, it makes sense to try to take advantage of it and improve even more the participation of the community. I believe that the budget could be a bit smaller, and that's my only negative point about the content of this proposal. Maybe half of the events and half of the budget would have a best cost/benefit relation.
Proposer has the experience to deliver on this plan.
description of the proposer seems to be enough, yet more information would be nice to have, even linkedin profile.

The experience appears suitable for the project being proposed. I would mirror other comments about the high cost of budget and feel with not too much effort a more streamlined budget could be found. This in my view is the only real concern.

The brief experience description that the team has put together could be enough for this proposal, though it would have been nice to have some extra information in that regard. While the event in itself is sufficiently described, the marketing side of it is lacking entirely. It's not enough to have a good idea for an event, if there are not enough people who can discover it and join. Maybe the fact that they consider partnering with the Addis Ababa University could help jump-start their marketing efforts.

The author of the proposal says he has experience with events in the industry, held in hotels, and also as digital marketing, two areas totally related to the project. Therefore, an initial trust is soon established. However, it would also be interesting to expose some examples of events and advertising campaigns carried out previously. I believe that a person already involved in the business is the first step towards a conscious conduct of events.

The proposal will be sucessfull if it gets people from decision-making echelons of Government and corporates to attend the event. The experience of the proposing team members in this aspect is not clearly coming out in the proposal.

The alleged experience is very well aligned with the proposal. Also, the roadmap is well explained, quantity of events is clear. Budget breakdown related to each part if the events is also good, but I believe it could be a bit lower, although this observation doesn't impact the proposal's feasibility.
This is a relatively simple proposal which clearly works towards building a community for Cardano in Ethiopia.

I understood the metrics, yet I would rather see to have the number of  "unique" participants, and demand growth over time, to participate in such meetings. 
Suggesting to the proposer.

Seems like a valid proposal that shares sufficient information. It would be good to see whom the team would be targeting for keynote speakers. I note talk of internships for students but could not see that in the budget?

The budget is straightforward and sensible. The number of participants per event is a metric that is easy to evaluate to get a sense of the project's success. The plan is realistic and even with some of the lacking information, it could still be implemented and easily verified.

The author of the proposal says he has experience with events in the industry, held in hotels, and also as digital marketing, two areas totally related to the project. Therefore, an initial trust is soon established. However, it would also be interesting to expose some examples of events and advertising campaigns carried out previously. I believe that a person already involved in the business is the first step towards a conscious conduct of events.

The proposal is about organizing events and hosting them on streaming platforms to improve awareness of Cardano. Therefore will be very straightforward to audit the progress. Details of exact people who will be attending will enable a better audit of the process.

This auditability of this proposal is as simple as checking if the events have really happened, and also the costs related to them. Also, some key metrics are mentioned and they are good to measure the impact of the proposal. Budget breakdown is good to understand how the budget will be spent. Some challenges should be assessed, like having enough people to present on these events, even thought this seems to be a very small risk.

solution: Start a networking event and invite a prominent speaker to each event. These would become the first blockchain meetups in Addis Ababa.
experience: Manage and run various events in the hotel industry in Addis Ababa and helped promote events. Have experience as a digital marketer in Addis
